verses.verse: Come down<WH3381>, and sit<WH3427> in the dust<WH6083>, O virgin<WH1330> daughter<WH1323> of Babylon<WH894>; sit<WH3427> on the ground<WH776> without a throne<WH3678>, O daughter<WH1323> of the Chaldeans<WH3778>: for thou shalt no more<WH3254> be called<WH7121> tender<WH7390> and delicate<WH6028>.

Take <WH3947> the millstones<WH7347>, and grind<WH2912> meal<WH7058>; remove<WH1540> thy veil<WH6777>, strip<WH2834> off the train<WH7640>, uncover<WH1540> the leg<WH7785>, pass through<WH5674> the rivers<WH5104>.
Thy nakedness<WH6172> shall be uncovered<WH1540>, yea<WH2781>, thy shame shall be seen<WH7200>: I will take<WH3947> vengeance<WH5359>, and will spare<WH6293> no man<WH120>.
Our Redeemer<WH1350>, Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is his name<WH8034>, the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478>.

Sit <WH3427> thou silent<WH1748>, and get<WH935> thee into darkness<WH2822>, O daughter<WH1323> of the Chaldeans<WH3778>; for thou shalt no more<WH3254> be called<WH7121> The mistress<WH1404> of kingdoms<WH4467>.

I was wroth<WH7107> with my people<WH5971>, I profaned<WH2490> mine inheritance<WH5159>, and gave<WH5414> them into thy hand<WH3027>: thou didst show<WH7760> them no mercy<WH7356>; upon the aged<WH2205> hast thou very<WH3966> heavily<WH3513> laid thy yoke<WH5923>.

And thou saidst<WH559>, I shall be mistress<WH1404> for ever<WH5769>; so that thou didst not lay<WH7760> these things to thy heart<WH3820>, neither didst remember<WH2142> the latter end thereof<WH319>.

Now therefore hear<WH8085> this<WH5719>, thou that art given to pleasures, that sittest<WH3427> securely<WH983>, that sayest<WH559> in thy heart<WH3824>, I am<WH657>, and there is none else besides me<WH3427>; I shall not sit as a widow<WH490>, neither shall I know<WH3045> the loss of children<WH7908>:

but these two<WH8147> things shall come<WH935> to thee in a moment<WH7281> in one<WH259> day<WH3117>, the loss of children<WH7908>, and widowhood<WH489>; in their full measure<WH8537> shall they come<WH935> upon thee<WH7230>, in the multitude of thy sorceries<WH3785>, and the great<WH3966> abundance<WH6109> of thine enchantments<WH2267>.

For thou hast trusted<WH982> in thy wickedness<WH7451>; thou hast said<WH559>, None seeth<WH7200> me<WH2451>; thy wisdom and thy knowledge<WH1847>, it hath perverted<WH7725> thee<WH559>, and thou hast said in thy heart<WH3820>, I am<WH657>, and there is none else besides me.

Therefore shall evil<WH7451> come<WH935> upon thee<WH3045>; thou shalt not know the dawning<WH7837> thereof<WH1943>: and mischief shall fall<WH5307> upon thee<WH3201>; thou shalt not be able to put it away<WH3722>: and desolation<WH7722> shall come<WH935> upon thee suddenly<WH6597>, which thou knowest not<WH3045>.

Stand <WH5975> now with thine enchantments<WH2267>, and with the multitude<WH7230> of thy sorceries<WH3785>, wherein<WH834> thou hast labored<WH3021> from thy youth<WH5271>; if so be thou shalt be able<WH3201> to profit<WH3276>, if so be thou mayest prevail<WH6206>.

Thou art wearied<WH3811> in the multitude<WH7230> of thy counsels<WH6098>: let now the astrologers<WH1895>, the star-gazers<WH2374>, the monthly<WH2320> prognosticators<WH3045>, stand up<WH5975>, and save<WH3467> thee from the things that shall come upon thee<WH935>.

Behold <WH7179>, they shall be as stubble; the fire<WH784> shall burn<WH8313> them<WH5337>; they shall not deliver themselves<WH5315> from the power<WH3027> of the flame<WH3852>: it shall not be a coal<WH1513> to warm<WH2552> at<WH217>, nor a fire to sit before<WH3427>.

Thus shall the things be unto thee wherein thou hast labored<WH3021>: they that have trafficked<WH5503> with thee from thy youth<WH5271> shall wander<WH8582> every one<WH376> to his quarter<WH5676>; there shall be none to save thee<WH3467>.
